s.text: The tragedy is that you never even get to anticipate spending your money, because you're smart enough to foresee the whole sequence of events even before it unfolds.
The tragedy is that you never even get to anticipate spending your money, because you're smart enough to foresee the whole sequence of events even before it unfolds.
Maybe this was what Bertolt Brecht meant when he said his life had been ruined by intelligence.
